hints.content:
**Perimeter** is the distance around the outside of a two-dimensional shape.

**Area** is the space inside of a two-dimensional shape. We can also think of area as the amount of space a shape covers.
The construction company wants to find out the amount of tape needed to go **around** the outside of the construction site, so they want to find the **perimeter**.

We can find the perimeter by adding all of the side lengths.  

[[☃ image 1]]

$\text{Perimeter} = \greenD{20}\text{ m} +\purpleC{40}\text{ m}+ \greenD{20}\text{ m}+\purpleC{40}\text{ m} = 120\text{ m}$

options.alt: A rectangle has sides labeled as follows: in green, 20 along the left side; in purple, 40 across the top; in green, 20 along the right side; and in purple 40 across the bottom. !

hints.content:
The construction company already has $100\text{ m}$ of tape but needs $120\text{ m}$. How much do they still need?

$120\text{ m} - 100\text{ m} = 20\text{ m}$
The construction company needs $20\text{ m}$ of tape.

question.content:
A construction company is starting to build a new house. They need to put tape around the site to begin. The new home site is $20$ meters wide by $40$ meter long rectangle. The company already has $100$ meters of tape.  

**How much more tape does the company need to tape the site?**
